javacsw.services.events

Interface ITelemetryServiceAdmin

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JTelemetryServiceAdmin

    public interface ITelemetryServiceAdmin
    Java admin API for the telemetry service.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<scala.Unit> shutdown()
      Shuts down the the database server (For use in test cases that started the database themselves)
      static java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> startTelemetryService(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Boolean noExit, scala.concurrent.ExecutionContext ec)
      Starts a redis instance on a random free port (redis-server must be in your shell path) and registers it with the location service.

    • Method Detail

      • shutdown

        java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<scala.Unit> shutdown()
        Shuts down the the database server (For use in test cases that started the database themselves)
        Returns:
        a future indicating when shutdown has completed

      • startTelemetryService

        static java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<scala.runtime.BoxedUnit> startTelemetryService(java.lang.String name,
                                                                                             java.lang.Boolean noExit,
                                                                                             scala.concurrent.ExecutionContext ec)
        Starts a redis instance on a random free port (redis-server must be in your shell path) and registers it with the location service. This is the equivalent of running this from the command line: {{{ tracklocation --name "Telemetry Service Test" --command "redis-server --port %port" --no-exit }}} This method is mainly for use by tests. In production, you would use the tracklocation app to start Redis once.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to use to register the telemetry service with the location service
        noExit - if true, do not exit the application when redis exists
        ec - required for futures
        Returns:
        a future that completes when the redis server exits
